website_summaries.verdict: High flow volume delivers enough product to stop bears in its tracks.
pros: Canister doesn't break down in the heat so it can be stored in a car
Powerful flow quickly puts product on target
cons: Shoots all contents in 5 seconds, which doesn't leave much room for error

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for farthest shooting, this is it.
customer_reviews.text: This is expensive but it's only for if you want pepper spray which shoots the farthest. I tested every brand & size of types of spray & stream for maximum distance, including Fox Labs 1Lb, Sabre Red large canisters, & all the smaller sizes of brands. This definitely shoots farther than any brand & size of pepper spray.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough sprays
customer_reviews.text: Received almost a month now, today I tried to used it, there is not a lot of spray come out! Must be defected! Want a replacement or return!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should carry one of these.
customer_reviews.text: I carry this religiously in an outside pocket on my back pack. I altered the mesh pocket to hold the can securely. I have been close to a bear since buying this, but it was on the other side of a window of my campervan and I was sleeping. The bear left paw prints that later collected fine dirt. My head was right on the other side of that window. As effective as this stuff would be on a bear, it will also work well on a dog, mountain lion, or violent screwtards in a pick up truck.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Q.

customer_reviews.title: $43 AND IT EXPIRES IN TEN MONTHS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Expires in TEN MONTHS!!! SO expensive, such a ripoff! They guarantee a three-years from the manufacturing date, but this junk has been sitting on the shelf forever. I am requesting a replacement with the proper expiration date!! Just think if I had gone walking with my toddler eleven months from now and had not checked the expiration date! In the area where we live and bears are plentiful and encounters are very common.
customer_reviews.author: Godzilla Ate Mars

customer_reviews.title: Saved my dog.
customer_reviews.text: I just had to order a new can. I got this product as protprotection for my wife and dog. My wife likes to walk our dog and several weeks ago a large dog came after her and the dog. This morning as she was walking. A big chow attacked our dog. My wife used your product and saved our dog and herself from being hurt. It worked great Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: carl  connell

customer_reviews.title: This stuff saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked way better then expected when I was attacked by a bear here recently in yellowstone national park. It was late at night and through the darkness I heard a noise near my camp. My girlfriend and I hunkered behind a tree and sure enough a big bear came trotting out towards us. Well thank the lord I had this bear spray with me because I don't think I would have made it out alive without it. All it took was one quick spray to the face and I was easily able to outrun my girlfriend who was immediately blinded and in pain. This pepper spray seems to be highly effective on both humans and bears.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Significant Leaking from the bottom
customer_reviews.text: I had the frontiersman Bear Spray sitting on a bedside end table. I noticed quite a bit of liquid and knew there hadn't been any type of cup in that location. Then I noticed the bottom fifth of the can of spray was discolored from moisture that had moved up from the leakage from the bottom of the can. Thankfully, I was able to clean up the mess with a towel, which had to be thrown away. I don't know if we i.e., myself, family, dogs, and bird will be physically harmed by such exposure.
customer_reviews.author: student

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t go a max of 35 feet it only gos about ten feet. Just used it on a bear that was 20 feet and didn’t even reach the bear.Do not buy this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fran Kratz

customer_reviews.title: Substituted product
customer_reviews.text: OK product and I have had none of the weird 1-star problems people spoke of. However, have two unusual gripes, serious ones. Made two orders of 9.2 oz product, but for both only received 7.9 oz container instead. Second gripe is that it said 3 year shelf life, but mine arrived with only 11 months shelf life remaining. I feel someone substituted aging removed from store shelf product for the new, larger ones I actually ordered. Update, Nov1,19: Contacted manufacturer directly based on their comment here, and they made the order good.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: awesome chemical defense
customer_reviews.text: well?..i was quite impressed with this product when i saw it used against a felon who was trying to rob a drugstore!..and then again i watched several videos on youtube of this product being used to deter several bears!..and so ?..i decided to buy 5 cannisters....and HOLY-TOLEDO!. this stuff WORKS! .((does'nt quite spray out 35 feet,tho?..more like about 15-20 feet))..do not let any of this stuff get on your skin!..it BURNS LIKE HELL!.even after smelling a little bit of it that i accidentally sprayed onto my shirt?....my nose was on fire for couple hours!....this stuff is the MOST AWESOME anti-personel deterrent!...this will stop ANY robber..OR dog on the street!!...worth it pple!! 5 star rating!
customer_reviews.author: namenkaten

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the crack heads off my porch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Once I spray them with this they go smoke their meth on the porch on the other side of the apartment complex. It's a great product. One hit and they are rolling on the ground crying, rolling and screaming. Their methamphetamine crystals fall on the ground, they can't run, and I call the cops. It's perfect for my application of keeping crack heads off my porch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Holster dissolved after 4 total miles of hiking
customer_reviews.text: I was on my second hike of my trip and the belt loop on the holster frayed so badly that the spray and holster fell from my hip about 2 miles into a 8 mile hike. If the workmanship of the spray is as poor as the holster, you will die if charged by a grisly. Fingers crossed that Amazon steps up on this Prime item.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed. I wonder how many people may be going ...
customer_reviews.text: The can feels full, expiry 2019. I decided to try it before my trip. It did not spray at all. I was amazed. I wonder how many people may be going around with a defective product unknowingly. I think you should try the product for an instant to see that it works. When trying to return the product Amazon said it was not returnable. I was shocked as it is a $40 product. In the end I called Amazon customer service and they refunded my credit card. I would have rather gone trekking with the bear protection. Not a pleasant buying experience.
customer_reviews.author: paul8574

customer_reviews.title: Maybe effective, only 2 years of shelf life ?!?
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this Bear Spray in anticipation of our summer vacation in Yellowstone this year. Spray may be potent and effective, but it was sold to me with only 2 years of shelf life remaining on them. I believe that industry standard for sale of new Bear Spray is 3-4 years of shelf life. I know that filler is still potent even after a few years, but delivery may be weakened by leaks from aerosol can (it is completely normal to lose some, or all the pressure in a few years), but I can’t take the risk of BS not working when needed (Yellowstone Grizzlies)!!! Looks like an old supply.
customer_reviews.author: John Forgac

customer_reviews.title: Beware...it’s a no fly product!
customer_reviews.text: This review is not for the product itself, I assume it works. However, I didn’t consider the fact that this cannot be taken on an airplane so unless you are driving to bear country, it’s not going to be of much help. In addition, for the same reasons, Amazon won’t allow returns on this product. Guess I’m stuck with a pretty useless bottle of bear spray in south Florida! I could put it on my porch and prove that it does keep bears away :-)!
customer_reviews.author: Schnelkc

customer_reviews.title: Can Exploded
customer_reviews.text: After carry this for 14 months in my motorcycle bag it exploded! Around elevation of 5700 ft above sea level the can exploded in my tool case. Not sure if was the elevation or being bounce around on back of my motorcycle that cause this. What a mess and very toxic residue on everything in the bag from the failure.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Can has no pressure, rendering it useless
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased for a trip to Rocky Mountain National Park where bear spray is recommended. First night in the woods, removed protective clip and proceeded to do a quick test shot to ensure I was ready for an encounter - nothing. Pushed as hard as I could and finally it gurgled a little bit and some brown liquid oozed out (no spray). Needless to say, had a very restless night concerned that I did not have the protection that I paid for. Will be requesting a return for this defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McAllister

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: If you have any problems buy it. great stuff, used it on an intruder. he went to jail, LOL
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Bear fears eased!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and an awesome sense of security! I fell while hiking and broke the safety cap on the product making it unsafe to carry for accidental discharge. Called the company and they immediately sent out a replacement!! Cannot ask for more, thanks for keeping your customers safe, and happy!!
customer_reviews.author: High Low

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the bears but our friendly nightly car robbing acquaintance stopped making his regular appearances after the first face shot from the balcony. Been nice and quiet for weeks now
customer_reviews.author: JoeBlow

customer_reviews.title: When You Need It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily for a home protector. No need to have a gun. Feel confident this will do the trick with a 35 foot trajectory. A burglar that get hit with this will wish he had picked another occupation. I though of this very product with the talk about school shootings and teachers that would likely shoot themselves in the foot with a gun. Pretty sure this would put someone in the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: MARK S.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff REALLY REALLY WORKS for PROTECTION against Robbers or bears
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for protection in my home in case of an intruder and by accident sprayed myself with it. I wanted to test it to make sure it worked. DO NOT TEST!!! I was temporaily blinded for about 30 minutes, insanely coughing to the point of almost throwing up and was thinking i need to call 911. It was in my eyes, mouth, lips etc. Also, I made the mistake of spraying it in my house. You do not have to spray directly at someone the vapor covers about 15 feet. 12 hours after I ever so lightly sprayed the mist the vapor was still in the room and got me a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: This Product Was Empty
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived empty. I was attacked by dogs, and this product dispensed no pepper spray. This product arrived missing the "remove after purchase" seal.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Colin Hall

customer_reviews.title: I hope to never have to use this product
customer_reviews.text: Piece of mind while camping in bear country. The videos I’ve seen of people shooting bears with guns are scary, as the bears sometimes keep charging, but when hit with spray they always turn tail and get gone, at least in the videos I have seen. I think I’ll trust it. My recommendation is that everyone in the group pack one in the handy hip holster.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Minor

customer_reviews.title: Instant results.
customer_reviews.text: If you are a cyclist this is the product for you. I wrapped some cardboard around the canister and tossed it in the bottle cage. I've had my fair share of run ins with "friendly" neighborhood dogs and it's safe to say I'm never doing that again. Putting my body in danger because people can't put up a fence is ridiculous. This canister is the right size for multiple uses and has the distance needed to intervene before it's too late.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Capella

customer_reviews.title: A possible Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Thank God I haven't had to use this yet so we ride our horses up in the mountains and camp at the tops. I gave a 5-star because the people I know, say that's it works better than my pistol because of the large pattern of pepper spray. But if it doesn't work and I get killed I'll have my wife revise this rating. On that note if I survive because of this product I'll be sending a thank you note to the company.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bryant Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: The case Feels like it will ruin in a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what is states. It will release a strong burst of deterrent that will hopefully make a four legged friend think twice about taking my picnic basket by force. Haven't used it thankfully. However I carry a can of Sabre product every day at work and they have to help me defend myself or others against aggressors of the two legged variety. Have confidence in what I carry for work, and have confidence in this. Sabre in my experience has been a reliable brand. What I deducted a star on is the carry case. It's cheap. Feels like it will ruin in a few uses. I would happily pay 5 more bucks for a heavier duty carrying rig.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: Doesn’t prevent shark attacks
customer_reviews.text: I never want to use this but holy gophers this thing will wreck anything with a nose from 30-40ft away! Amazing defense tool from all types of animal attacks! Doesn’t work on sharks it turns out, and it won’t stop a dolphin from sexually assaulting you but it works incredibly well on your mother in law, and hedgehogs
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Schara

customer_reviews.title: Like the product and can only assume it will be ...
customer_reviews.text: Like the product and can only assume it will be a deterrent if/when I run into a bear again. However, the "holster" started to come apart where the belt loop is attached. This occurred the first time I wore it.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Brassfield

customer_reviews.title: brought 3 of these last trip to bear country. ...
customer_reviews.text: brought 3 of these last trip to bear country. I do not know if they will stop a bear but I cannot carry a gun into the area I was in. They make a testing product to let you see how far it goes and its dispersion. It releases in a large cloud so you should always be aware of airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap holster. It WILL fall apart on you and ...
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap holster. It WILL fall apart on you and render it useless. Do not buy unless you plan on carrying it another way.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: If it doesn't work I probably won't be around to return it! lol
customer_reviews.text: I went with it because it was tested 20 miles from me. It was supposed to be delivered on a friday. I was going huckleberry picking sunday. It arrived monday. That is why it only got 4 stars from me. The product itself seems good. Easy to remove the safety stop and replace if you didn't use. I did some practice "draws" but didn't try firing. I might order another can for my wife and get us both some of the inert test cans to practice with even though it seems simple in theory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holster and Safety were great, TSA will confiscate from checked luggage
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, we never had to use this bear spray so I can't attest to it's effectiveness; however, having the holster was convenient for quick access and the glow in the dark safety was a nice feature. What we did not know is that TSA would confiscate it even in a checked bag. If you're flying somewhere and you need bear spray, I would get it there or ship it ahead to yourself.
customer_reviews.author: LawyerLady

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes bears want more than honey.
customer_reviews.text: Over the last 30 years I have camped and backpacked often in bear country. This is the bear spray I keep renewing after the canisters expire. Although I have tested these out to know they shoot a quick solid stream, I’ve never had to use the spray on a bear. I have had several bear encounters where I was ready to use the spray, but never actually had to. I hike confidently knowing I have this as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Zyrlu

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a good product at a reasonable cost that I hope to never need to use
customer_reviews.text: I hike all the time, but am never bothered by bears in my area (mostly black bear) as to date they've all run when they hear or see me as I'm both large and can be loud. I bought the chemical spray mostly to prevent future attacks on my dog from other mean and out of control dogs as well as bears. Just one stomach puncture costs over $500 at the vet, and while that's only happened twice I don't want it to happen anymore so perhaps this will help prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Frontiersman Bear Spray
customer_reviews.text: Must have worked. Wore it on my belt for 2 weeks and didn't encounter any bears:) Honestly I absolutely recommend. Even though no bears were encountered, I felt comfortable in the Grizzly inhabited mountains of NE Idaho just West of Yellowstone. I believe buying the inert practice spray was beneficial as I didn't want the first time I tried the spray to be under vital circumstances. The one downside to the package I purchased is that is doesn't come with a holster for the bear spray.....which I purchased separately as it is definitely a necessity. Bear spray in your backpack will do you no good when needed. Jim Speegle
customer_reviews.author: James Speegle

customer_reviews.title: Test bottle is an important extra!
customer_reviews.text: My family is out in nature a-lot, and we may also rely on the bear spray if a human intruder tries to enter our RV. We all tried the test can, which is full of water, just to see how the unit works. It was much more powerful than I had expected, so it was great to have this test experience. Hope we never need the real can, but nice to know it's there if we do.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln A. Kroll

customer_reviews.title: Bears Chase Me
customer_reviews.text: So these ferocious bears are always chasing me. I peddle past their house and they come charging off their porch and endanger themselves crossing the road. I've been able to teach the bears to not chase me and now I've probably saved their lives. The blast is exceptional and you can do short bursts. I've done about four short bursts so far. I zip tied the holster to the front of my bike and so I can get to it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hartselle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Product, ok? Canister design, a fail!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to deploy this brand of spray but I have used something similar and it does put out a big blast! That said, the "safety" mechanism is a joke and greatly increases accidental exposure to the spray. Another note: Both the zip tie and the "remove after purchase" seal were missing from the can I received. I contacted Amazon and they are sending a replacement. I've seen several reviews mentioning the seals were missing from "new" cans. I would not trust the product to work if the seals are not intact.
customer_reviews.author: ECHO444

customer_reviews.title: No charge gage like fire extinguishers have
customer_reviews.text: It SHOULD have a positive charge gage like fire extinguishers have. A couple stories that in an emergency it was dead. Reason was a factory defect. The ease of replacement is conditional if you survive the grissly bear attack.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Have purchased this brand for years
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Have purchased this brand for years. Fortunately have only had to use it on aggressive dogs. No desire to use it for a bear encounter but nice to have it on my pack if ever necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Forrest Davy

customer_reviews.title: A good alternative to a firearm where personal safety is concerned
customer_reviews.text: A good alternative to a firearm where personal safety is concerned. I travel extensively and keep this canister in my automobile door storage area in case it is ever needed. In my travels, there have been two occasions in which I would have used this spray had it been available. Now, with this product, I feel a bit safer on the open highway where anything can, and sometimes does happen.
customer_reviews.author: DrWoody

customer_reviews.title: I feel secure in the forest now
customer_reviews.text: I carry this product every time I go out with my 2 dogs. There are bears here along the Oregon coast from time to time. If I feel threatened by a bear, loose dogs or some jerk, this will fix the problem. The belt holder is perfect and very secure. yet, the can is easy to draw and prime for use (remove safety key that is) I highly recommend this product. Though I have not had to blast beast or man beast with it, sure nice to have for my treks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than mace.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a product that would help against aggressive dogs or hhm people when I'm out late at night. This is it. Irresponsible dog owners let their dogs run free and I dont want them to attack me or my dog which has happened once before. I tested it by spraying a small amount down wind. I could smell a little of this product and my nose began to drain, left eye burned, and I began to cough. I couldn't get away fast enough. I'm definitely buying again.
customer_reviews.author: zzraks

customer_reviews.title: EXPIRED: CANNOT USE
customer_reviews.text: The short of it was: wasn't able to test it b/c product already expired. They really need an inventory dept. Couldn't return do to regulations. Wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cavelle

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate description of product.
customer_reviews.text: I am sure that the item I ordered included the shoulder holster option. I paid the higher price to get this feature. However, when I try to look up the item, it no longer shows this option, so I am unable to verify that detail. Thus, I am somewhat dissatisfied with this order. I am not in a position to return the item, as we are leaving on a summer trip and there isn't time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Biersdorf

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had to use on zombies yet, just giving you the benefit of the doubt it’ll work when needed. Got a couple extras, gonna burn one to see. If it don’t work as promised I’ll update this review. If it does...great fantastic...a must buy. 😝
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barney

customer_reviews.title: How to review?
customer_reviews.text: I don't really know how you can review this without testing the exact bottle you have. But I hate when people leave bad reviews and say they haven't used the item yet, so I will give it a positive review. I will come back if it doesn't work and I get attacked by a bear and survive.
customer_reviews.author: Marie WTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Bear spray - just in case
customer_reviews.text: Hard to review a product you don't really get to use. Purchased this for our Yellowstone/Grand Tetons vacation. Luckily we only saw 1 small juvenile black bear from a distance. Had this hooked to my belt as we hiked a bit. Nice to have handy if you need it. Has a good reputation but never used it. Better safe than sorry I suppose. :)
customer_reviews.author: TX Geek

customer_reviews.title: Raccoons beware
customer_reviews.text: I have nuisance raccoons who aren't afraid of people and keep destroying decorations and plants. Once they show up to my house for a night, they keep coming back no matter how many times I chase them off. I've tried everything to deter them and finally had some luck with a small keychain pepper spray product. This bear spray is extra potent and has a great range. It makes it way easier to get a good hit on them without getting too close. Definitely my go-to deterrent now.
customer_reviews.author: Harp

customer_reviews.title: Hope I never have to use it
customer_reviews.text: I feel a little better about hiking in bear country with this spray. It says it sprays up to 35 feet, which is still pretty close. I've never had to use it, thankfully, so it's hard to give a review on something I haven't actually used. But I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt, trusting it will do what it's supposed to, and so until proven wrong, I'm giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Greg O

customer_reviews.title: Roadblock? Not an issue
customer_reviews.text: Worried about getting stuck on the highway with a blockade of “peaceful protesters” who turn on you and your family? This is a great way to clear out the crowd for about 5 seconds of intense spray. Highly recommend you keep a can of this in your car...
customer_reviews.author: Ilovechocolate

customer_reviews.title: Missing Safety Clip and Unusable Holster
customer_reviews.text: Ordered qty 2 and one was missing the safety clip and the other one had a defective holster (sewing on belt loop was not attached so it cannot be worn on belt). The canisters seemed like they were in good condition. I would like a replacement holster and safety clip but have not been able to initiate a warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my wife while she is out bike riding. Has stopped a few unwanted dogs going after her. No bears yet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Glasemann

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend getting the Frontiersman Bear Spray Belt Holster to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my brother. He hasn't had to use it yet, but it does give him a piece of mind knowing he has it on his hip. I would recommend getting the Frontiersman Bear Spray Belt Holster to have on your side!
customer_reviews.author: MJ L

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, ships UPS - holster is quite small
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the product but have read reviews on outdoor guides. It beats the competition on distance, 35 feet, but you only get about a 5 second blast for the 9.2oz bottle. The holster barely fits me and I have it adjusted all the way out. I am 5'10" 175lbs with about a 38" chest. You do not want this in a pack when seconds count, there is a belt loop on the back of the holster itself.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t spray far
customer_reviews.text: Used at my brothers house for the bears that come in his yard. It didn’t work as well as said in add. Not a very long spray. This will not help if a bear enters his yard.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra wolf

customer_reviews.title: Holster needs reinforcement.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I haven't had to use this yet...Thank God! But I have taken it on a couple back country trips and I've strapped it to my belt as well as my pack and the holster belt loop separated partially from the back of the holster. I had to sew it to reinforce it, and I've had no problems since. Just be sure you don't snag it on something because it may cause it to tear that belt loop and if you should need the spray you may be wishing you had a better holster.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The right stuff to get rid of unwanted animals.
customer_reviews.text: It's good stuff but don't spray it with the wind blowing in your direction.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Effective Against Humans
customer_reviews.text: If it can stop a bear, it can stop a man; get yourself a can.
customer_reviews.author: Or9525

customer_reviews.title: Did not go off accidentally.  Did not need to use!
customer_reviews.text: Saw a bear but he had no cares about us being there. Hard to rate a product one doesn't use, but it didn't go off accidentally (which was one of my big fears). Consider renting this at the ranger stations though instead of buying it like us and then having to leave it behind. It cannot be taken onto planes. It is a bit awkward to hold and I doubt one could use this properly with one hand (like advertised).
customer_reviews.author: TheStig

customer_reviews.title: nice size.
customer_reviews.text: nice size and I'm here to write about it. didn't have to use it . we'll see about " Opener" in MT. Life time guarantee? hahahahahahahaa 9.6 oz. expires in 3 years....... good to know!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kip D

customer_reviews.title: The easily read (picture) instructions are not on the can itself, but in the packaging. I tore it off and tapped it to the can.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use this yet, but I certainly feel safer with it on my pack. I do a lot of solo backpacking trips and have had a few non-threatening encounters with black bears. Even thought they were non-threatening, they were still immensely horrifying. This product has definitely made me feel more safe out in the wilderness. I even bought a second can for the house (just in case an intruder decides to break in).
customer_reviews.author: Al Mc

customer_reviews.title: and everything looks good. I haven't had to use this yet
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars because it showed up fast, and everything looks good. I haven't had to use this yet, so if you don't hear from me, maybe the product didn't work and I've been eaten by a bear....
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Expiration date Vs. Manufacture Date
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that they talk about a 3 year self life from Manufacture date, and when arrived the Expiration Date was 2 years and 3 months from purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A spray for justice.
customer_reviews.text: After the recent rash of raccoon attacks in my neighborhood, I decided that this was the only viable option for my family while we walk our pet Komodo Dragon. We live near a mountain and the raccoons have been attacking children and other lizards (we live in a lizard sanctuary/re-homing area). Any raccoon better pay heed to the spray of this caliber. Will post results if I come across them.
customer_reviews.author: RuffPops21

customer_reviews.title: It's a stopper for sure
customer_reviews.text: Good stream and distance. Accidentally hit the trigger trying to squeeze through a gate and sprayed in my cargo pocket, I just couldn't imagine it not deterring anything. Couldn't get home quickly enough to wash my leg.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution!
customer_reviews.text: Man. This thing is a beast! It’s is way way stronger than regular pepper spray too. Big strong mist and pretty accurate. Make sure the wind ain’t blowing in your direction or you’ll just ruin your week.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo2out

customer_reviews.title: Fast to deploy and a powerful spray
customer_reviews.text: It deploys quickly and without any snags. With a little practice I can grab it out, remove the safety, and spray in less than two seconds, which is all the time you have if an animal is charging. Don't wait until the animal is right on you though, because it sprays for quite a distance (I recommend test-firing it for an instant so you know how it sprays. I also keep it in my truck with me just in case I run into problems with humans as well, even though it's not intended for that.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bird

customer_reviews.title: Expires in 19 months...
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to buy this product, but the one I received expires next September (2021). It's February 2020 now. Definitely feel like I got a throw-away. I would recommend buying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as described and shoots a huge plume of aerosol out. Haven’t used it on a bear but the stuffed that was in the air was enough to choke me out.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Also good for two legged animals but always aim for the ...
customer_reviews.text: have not used it, my friend brought down a cougar with it. Make sure you practice with the chest holster. Also make sure you clip the safety cord..Also good for two legged animals but always aim for the groin, it can cause blindness in humans.
customer_reviews.author: fair trade

customer_reviews.title: Bear country
customer_reviews.text: Was taking a trip to Montana and everywhere when reading said to get bear spray. So bought some from Amazon so we didn't over spend while in Montana. Picked this one because it wouldn't explode in car. Never had to use it and did lots of hiking. Never saw a bear. Good for a few years so maybe next time.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Carry it within arm's reach...
customer_reviews.text: Better to have it and not need it, than to need it and not have it. Wouldn't be caught hiking around in grizz country without it. The important thing is to carry it where you can access it quick...and not in the pack on your back. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wheelgunner

customer_reviews.title: Sprays really far, easy to use, recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well ran in front of a mother black bear and cubs, flagged a car down before having to use it. Did defend myself against people's untied dogs that tried to bite me as I ran, worked well!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Carson

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Have had to use this 4 times so far and each time the crime type person folded into a womb like stance on the ground, which is what this does...
customer_reviews.author: roger crown

customer_reviews.title: RV Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I lived in the mountains for 3 yrs. You need the spray to protect yourself and it also teaches the bear not to get close to humans. The bear was on my porch her cub went up the tree by my kitchen window. Hearing that under the breath is a scary growl. The sound on the other side of the wall.. just a little ways from me, sent chills down my spine!
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Bear Spray, good for Beast or Man.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this...I hope I never have to. Sort of a paradox eh? I should use it just to see how it works, but then I'd need to buy a new one. So I hope it works good. The idea, is to be prepared on the trail, just in case Bear or Cougar should make an appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Rog H

customer_reviews.title: Expires 2023
customer_reviews.text: Got two cans of this for griz country backpacking out west for this fall. The bottles were packed well and arrived just fine as they should. The expiration dates are 6-2023 and we'll use them for at least two years. Three years is plenty for a can of OC spray.
customer_reviews.author: JX

customer_reviews.title: Hard to rate until I use it.
customer_reviews.text: I certainly hope it works if needed. I'll be up the creek if it doesn't. How do you rate a product like this?
customer_reviews.author: ARTHUR RANDOLPH MONTGOMERY

customer_reviews.title: Feel safer
customer_reviews.text: I carry this in my car for a first offence against road rage! It is illegal to carry on your hip in some states,like NC.
customer_reviews.author: Roadbilly

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, but HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: It's great although I've never had to use it, but please note that it is HUGE! I'm sure I'll appreciate it if I ever run into a bear or other lethal-sized varmint, but my goodness the can is almost a foot tall! Obviously NOT mace-sized. At any rate, I have hiked with it in the woods, and while it's a nuisance to carry if you're just using a fanny pack, I'd hate to be without it if I ran into a cougar or bear or wolf.
customer_reviews.author: Quee

customer_reviews.title: A must in bear country
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Was accidentally tested on one of our team and we can vouch for effectiveness on humans. Handle carefully. Not a toy. A must on bear country. Harness and case are usefull and effective for carrying. Make sure you carry it so you can deploy quickly. Most attacks give you 4 seconds or less warning.
customer_reviews.author: KAL In GilbertAZ

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Hiking in Black Bear country, at the time my hiking destination had a lot of recent activity included bears approaching people, and other high amounts of activity. What is peace of mind worth to you? For me it's worth the price and the weight. I really don't want to actually find out the effectiveness of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: TSA prohibits bear spray!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good product, but....TSA regs- “You can bring chemical repellents in your checked bag if the volume is less than 4 ounces and.... Most bear repellents exceed this limitation.” Buy this when you get there!
customer_reviews.author: Kaye Majoch

customer_reviews.title: it's exactly what it needs to be - strong mace that is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have not had to use it. Just possessing it must be scaring the bears away. Seriously, it's exactly what it needs to be - strong mace that is easy to use. I keep 2 in my camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Hard to review something I hope I'll never need to use
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are straightforward in use, get a practice one if you're not sure, good size, fits well on my pack for easy reach, could probably get a hip pocket for even quicker access. Hopefully I'll never have need of this, but in bear country this is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest L. Johnson III

customer_reviews.title: Very nice + Belt Clip!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 2 week vaca way up in the mountains of bear country. Saw 4 bears, but didn't need to use it. However, it gave me great peace of mind to have this, in case of an attacking bear, moose, or big cat up in the mountains. I'll definitely have this on hand whenever I'm in those areas, and confident it'll save a life, no doubt! Be safe. Not sorry!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeakelkat

customer_reviews.title: Good bear spray, well I hope
customer_reviews.text: I put a little of this behind my ears before going out into the woods of Montana, hasn't attracted a griz yet. Actually, I have no idea if the stuff works. If I ever get attacked by a grizzly and live throught it I will let you know.......
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously ... Bear Spray?
customer_reviews.text: Headed to NorthWest, husband insisted we needed bear spray (he reads too much?). For peace of mind, and safety i suggested he order a can of this. Glad we did. We didn't see a bear, and the husband was happy to have the spray.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette  LeDoux

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: We lived by Yellowstone this past summer and would go hiking in bear country every week. Fortunately we never had to use this. But it brought us a lot of peace of mind! We kept it in the water bottle pocket on the side of a backpack for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hodge

customer_reviews.title: faulty product delivered
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the 5th or 6th of this item I have purchased over the years. The one that arrived today did not have the plastic tie that prevents the loss of the trigger guard when the trigger guard is slid back. I fixed it myself but anyone else who gets one of these without a trigger guard should know that using a small cable tie does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Klein

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet but...
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work for bears and other creatures capable of standing on two legs.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne LaPierre

customer_reviews.title: This sucker is huge
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is huge. Not easy to carry around. Initially bought it for protection from dogs while walking with my little dog. Not really practical for that, but should do the job when hiking on trails and such.
customer_reviews.author: PeterTheGreat

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE, NOT RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE, PRODUCT IS NOT RETURNABLE. I understand this product is flammable and has shipping restrictions but I am upset that I cannot return it to Amazon. They mailed it to me, why can't I mail it back?
customer_reviews.author: ryan h

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Good size, weight but never got to use it. It got stolen out of my hiking pack, damn bears.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler weaver

customer_reviews.title: Shoots a stream a long way, make sure the wind is at your back..
customer_reviews.text: Shoots a long stream, thankfully never had to use it on a bear.
customer_reviews.author: theodore Richard

customer_reviews.title: It's kept the bears away so far.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't needed to use it. (Knock on wood) However, the holster holds the canister securely, and I trust it will do its job should I need it. The only criticism I have of the product thus far is that I wish it came with or offered an option for a molle compatible holster. I use a Ribz tactical pack for hiking, and it took a little work to get it set up. After seeing the videos, and researching other sprays, I'm happy with the product, and I hope I never have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Luckily, I have no idea if this is effective...
customer_reviews.text: ...but it came as advertised, is sized to be reasonably convenient to carry, and if you get the holster it seems efficient enough and has held up (so far) to backpacking through the Wind River Range.
customer_reviews.author: Old Navy

customer_reviews.title: Descend yourself against any wildlife or low life
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for any outdoor running in with predators, not just animal predators, but this baby will do a number on any attacker. Not just animal. Need to make that point very well stated.
customer_reviews.author: Armageddon-Medic

product_meta.title: SABRE Frontiersman Bear Spray 9.2 oz (Holster Options & Multi-Pack Options) — Maximum Strength, Maximum Range & Greatest Protective Barrier Per Burst! — Effective Against All Types of Bears
product_meta.description: Whether you are an avid camper, hiker, or just someone who loves to explore the great outdoors, FRONTIERSMAN Bear Spray is a must-have for added peace of mind on your next adventure. The 9.2 oz spray combines maximum stopping power with a superior range of 35 feet, meaning you can deploy it from a safer distance to deter an aggressive bear. It travels up to 15 feet (4.6 m) farther than other bear sprays to put more distance between you and the attacking bear. FRONTIERSMAN Bear Spray is a quick-to-deploy bear defense spray made with the maximum strength allowed by the E.P.A. (2.0% major capsaicinoids - 50% stronger than SABRE's maximum strength police pepper spray). The 9.2 oz canister provides maximum protection by rapidly deploying the heaviest fog of up to 1.84 oz (52 grams) per 1-second burst (up to 84% more than other brands) and creating a massive barrier of protection between you and the charging bear to maximize your safety. FRONTIERSMAN Bear Spray is available with holster options for the quickest access when seconds matter. When an 800 lb. bear is charging up to 50 feet (15 m) per second, every moment counts. Holsters keep your canister secure and immediately accessible without any cumbersome straps or velcro closures that can disturb the bear or cost you precious seconds as you try to access your spray. Explore confidently knowing you have the best bear safety products on the market with you from FRONTIERSMAN. From the makers of the #1 selling maximum strength bear spray, FRONTIERSMAN bear safety products include FRONTIERSMAN Bear Sprays, Inert Practice Spray, Bear Bells, and more. FRONTIERSMAN is a product of SABRE. With over 45 years of experience manufacturing pepper spray, SABRE is the #1 trusted pepper spray brand by consumers and police officers worldwide. SABRE pepper sprays, pepper gels, and bear sprays are proudly manufactured in the U.S.A.
feature_bullets: GREATEST PROTECTION AT SAFEST DISTANCE - 35 FEET: Traveling up to 15 feet (4.6 m) farther than other bear attack deterrents this 9.2 oz bear spray delivers more distance between you and an attacking bear as they charge up to 35 miles per hour!

GREATEST PROTECTIVE BARRIER PER BURST: Rapidly deploys the heaviest fog of 1.84 oz (52 grams) per 1-second burst (up to 84% more than other brands) to help maximize your safety by deploying a massive barrier of protection to help deter a charging bear

RIGOROUSLY TESTED FOR CERTAINTY AND PEACE OF MIND: E.P.A. and Health Canada approved, our environmentally friendly bear spray is field-tested and proven effective against all types of bears by the Elmendorf Air Force Base and Brown Bear Resources

SAFER FOR YOU, THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE BEAR: FRONTIERSMAN temporarily incapacitates a bear’s ability to see or smell while causing no permanent injuries; Safe to use while camping, it is non-flammable, and does not contain any ozone-depleting chemicals

MAXIMUM STOPPING POWER: The only bear spray with an in-house HPLC lab to guarantee maximum strength (50% stronger than police strength pepper spray) and eliminate the 30% fail rate experienced by other brands (U. of UT); MADE IN THE U.S.A.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
